text:
[Page 1]
Bulletin No. 56 
Operations Bulletin 
Aug 2012 
Joint Inspection Group 
 
 
 
JIG Aviation Fuel Quality Control & Operating 
Standards - Issue 11 Amendments 
 
The first two pages of each of the Issue 11 Standards consist of a summary of the main 
changes made from the previous issue of the JIG documents. 
A more detailed list of changes has now been developed to assist with the process of 
updating Operations and Quality Control Manuals to meet Issue 11 requirements. Also, a 
number of minor errors have been identified since the Standards (JIG 1, JIG 2 and JIG 3) 
were published in January. 
The tables attached to this bulletin identify all of the changes and corrections. The following 
terminology has been used to describe the changes and corrections: 
New/new text, new/changed requirement, changed terminology or clarification - a 
change from Issue 10 
Correction - a correction to an error noted in the text of Issue 11 
 
 
 
 
Action for JIG JVs 
JIG JV Management shall review the tables of changes attached to this bulletin and update 
their Operations and Quality Control Manuals and Procedures to ensure compliance with 
Issue 11 before the end of 2012. 
 
 
This document is intended for the guidance of Members of the Joint Inspection Group (JIG) and 
companies affiliated with Members of JIG, and does not preclude the use of any other operating 
procedures,

s document is intended for the guidance of Members of the Joint Inspection Group (JIG) and 
companies affiliated with Members of JIG, and does not preclude the use of any other operating 
procedures, equipment or inspection procedures. Neither JIG, its Members, the companies affiliated 
with its Members nor the International Air Transport Association (IATA) accepts responsibility for the 
adoption of this document or compliance with this document. Any party using this document in any 
way shall do so at its own risk.
